column7: PLC’s and leadership. Multiple measures including CAASPP\rresults
column10: and data from site walk through/educational rounds were utilized to prioritize needs.\rAdditionally
column11: TUSD’s initiatives and staff input continue to drive the professional development offerings.\r\rStaff is provided with weekly embedded collaboration time in addition to opportunities for extended collaboration at site determined periods throughout\rthe school year.  The collaboration time allows teachers to apply new learning and make strategic decisions regarding the use of curriculum and\rassessments.\r\rYear one and year two teachers are enrolled in TUSD’s Induction Program.   The Induction Program activities are based on the California Standards for\rthe Teaching Profession which outlines the numerous interconnected skills that comprise the professional practices of teaching. New administrators are\rsupported through their participation in the Stanislaus County Office of Education Administrator Induction Program.\r\rProfessional development and support has been provided in the following areas: Professional Learning Communities; Math Instruction; ELA/ELD\rInstruction; Special Education; Instructional Best Practices; Guided Language Acquisition and Design (GLAD); Advanced Placement; Standards-Based\rReport Cards; Technology; Digital Citizenship
column12: Small Group Instruction; and Next Generation Science Standards. Professional development opportunities\roccur during a combination of the regular school day
column14: and during the summer. TUSD has a network of nineteen content specialist instructional\rcoaches that are utilized to support staff in classroom implementation as a follow up to all professional development events.\r\rThere are several formal Special Education administrative
